td.paragraph: Reveals bilateral renal atrophy with the absence of any hydronephrosis
Her Cr has progressively increased from 80 to 175 umol/L with a current eGFR of 32 mL/min. Her most recent protein:Cr is elevated at 201 mg/mmol

item.caption: Thorough, John - 04/12/2016 4:29 PM CDT
item.paragraph: From a renal perspective, over the last 3 years her Cr has progressively increased from 80 to 175 umol/L with a current eGFR of 32 mL/min. Her most recent protein:Cr is elevated at 201 mg/ mmol. She has noted worsening peripheral edema and despite my best efforts, her glycemic control remains suboptimal. Lastly, her renal ultrasound reveals bilateral renal atrophy with the absence of any hydronephrosis.
